page.title: 01PEWSEY
page.content: Pewsey is a small market town on the River Avon about seven miles south-west of Marlborough. It has agricultural and light industrial employment and is on the main railway line to Paddington, so many residents are daily or weekly commuters. The town is the main community centre for the Vale of Pewsey, which has been officially designated as "an area of outstanding natural beauty". The main educational, leisure, social services and fire prevention services and law courts for the Vale are centred in Pewsey. The Kennet and Avon Canal, which links Bristol with London, flows close to the town centre. It is navigable by pleasure craft.
